channel.title: PHB Ranger
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "PHB Ranger" - PHB Ranger is notably missing from *everywhere* on the internet. Please add it.

item.title: Re: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded: Thank you! I would have done it but I wanted consensus before I made page-wide decisions.

item.title: Re: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded:
Fixed the URL, my OCD was telling me to fix it, but my laziness was fighting it. Your post swung the battle towards the OCD.

Also fixed Extra Attack, it is now represented correctly as a 5th-level Ranger feature and has been removed from the subclass options.

item.title: Re: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded:
I would like the official Ranger page to not be named "Old" in the url, though. As annoying as it is to shift that content, I think it would confuse new players when they see "/ranger" and "/ranger-old"

We also need to discuss Extra Attack in the Ranger subclasses - it exists for Revised Ranger subclasses but not for PHB Ranger who has that for class feature.

item.title: Re: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded: PHB Ranger is now linked on the main page.

item.title: Re: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded: Post a link when you're done, we'll figure something out.

item.title: Re: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded: Working on it, though I have zero idea where to put a link to it.

item.title: PHB Ranger
item.content:encoded:
I've noticed that the only place I can find PHB Ranger is Roll20, where they only have the Hunter subclass. Seeing as how this site pretty efficiently adds and updated all of the D&D content I have ever seen, it only makes sense that the PHB Ranger - which is objectively better than Revised Ranger - should be on here. (Beast Master I am looking at you.) I have no qualms with keeping Revised Ranger on here, since it is an undeniable facts some people prefer it - however some people also prefer the official Published Ranger and its play style, and it would be immensely helpful to have on here. It only makes sense to have at least the SRD classes at the bare minimum, not to mention all of the subclasses on here that were designed with official Ranger in mind, and not Revised Ranger. (Wizards if the Coast actually declared they scrapped the idea of Revised Ranger in its entirety - for good reason.)
If you would change it, that would be a great help for me, and several others, who are stuck playing online D&D games, and want an easy way to copy and paste the official Ranger class features.
